sentence: Arizona Democratic U.S. Sen. Mark Kelly also touched on Biden’s statement regarding prescription drug prices, as well as microchip manufacturing, saying he was happy to see the president focused on getting legislation into law.
author: TORRENCE DUNHAM
title: Arizona politicians react to President Joe Biden’s first State of the Union address

sentence: Sen. Mark Kelly, D-Ariz., also noted the manufacturing issue, while calling for inflation-fighting moves to aid Americans.
author: Ronald J. Hansen
title: Unity at start of Biden's State of the Union speech gives way to familiar domestic battles

sentence: It’s unacceptable to end Title 42 without a plan and coordination in place to ensure a secure, orderly and humane process at the border,” said Sen. Mark Kelly, whose comments were echoed by fellow Arizona Democratic Sen. Kyrsten Sinema.
author: Emily Sacia
title: With Title 42 winding down, worries rise about handling migrant surge

sentence: Kyrsten Sinema, D-Ariz., and Mark Kelly, D-Ariz., oppose ending the policy without a "comprehensive, workable plan in place," saying the would overwhelm Arizona border communities and stretch the resources of nonprofits that are already near capacity.
author: Clara Migoya
title: What is Title 42 and how does it affect the Arizona border? The immigration policy, explained

sentence: Kyrsten Sinema (D-AZ), Mark Kelly (D-AZ), James Lankford (R-OK), John Cornyn (R-TX), Joe Manchin (D-WV), Shelley Moore Capito (R-WV), Jon Tester (D-MT), Rob Portman (R-OH), Maggie Hassan (D-NH), Thom Tillis (R-NC), and John Thune (R-SD) sponsored the Senate version of the bill.
author: Sean Moran
title: House Democrats Push Back on Joe Biden’s Ending of Title 42

sentence: Meanwhile, Senators Krysten Sinema and Mark Kelly of Arizona, Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire, Joe Manchin of West Virginia and Jon Tester of Montana have signed onto similar legislation in Congress' upper chamber.
author: Andrew Stanton
title: Henry Cuellar Becomes Sixth House Democrat to Oppose Biden Lifting Title 42

sentence: “The Biden administration was wrong to set an end date for Title 42 without a comprehensive plan in place,” Sen. Mark Kelly said earlier this month, as he introduced a bill to delay that move.
author: Reagan Priest
title: Border numbers hit highest level in 20 years, as end of Title 42 looms
